details:
It was discovered that there where a number of vulnerabilities in irssi,
the terminal based IRC client:


* [CVE-2018-7050](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7050)
Null pointer dereference for an empty nick.
* [CVE-2018-7051](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7051)
Certain nick names could result in out-of-bounds
 access when printing theme strings.
* [CVE-2018-7052](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7052)
When the number of windows exceeds the available space, a
 crash could occur due to another NULL pointer dereference.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these issues have been fixed in irssi version
0.8.15-5+deb7u5.


We recommend that you upgrade your irssi packages.
